alert.note: Alert for Phillips (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 12 at 6:26PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Phillips, eastern Furnas and western Harlan Counties through 700 PM CDT... At 626 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Edison to near Hollinger to 8 miles northwest of Almena. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Hollinger around 630 PM CDT. Oxford around 640 PM CDT. Stamford around 645 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Long Island, Orleans and Woodruff. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for north central Kansas...and south central Nebraska.
